moves.1. e3: Van't Krujis opening.  A little unusual, but I used to open this way frequently in my youth.
moves.2. g3 e5 3. Bg2 Nf6 4. Ne2 Bd6 5. O-O O-: Pe4xPd4 e.p. is also acceptable here.
This would have been a lovely fork, save for NxP.
moves.14. Bxf3 Bxf3 15. Rxf3 Qe6 16. Qc2 g6: Ph7 is not in mortal danger.
?  Bishop for rook?  White would have been better off moving the queen.  Qd2 at least threatens black's a pawn.
moves.25... Qa7+: I liked Rc5 better, as it both defended Pa5 while attacking Pd5.  But this is halfway decent too.
Trades work to black's advantage.  Especially RvN.
moves.40. b4 Rb6 41. Nd7 Ra6 42. b5 Rxa3 43. b: ?  White cannot win without that pawn.  The best white can hope for would be a draw.
moves.50... Kc8: ?  I don't think black can chase down the white horse, or should waste time trying.  Though pushing it against the far right side of the board while the pawns are on the left may be a decent long term strategy.  Black's king is better off shepherding pawns, or gutting the king.  Pg blocks any further movement of the h pawn.  So Pf should be promoted.
